de.exobros.exogdx.sbg

Class StateBasedGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.exobros.exogdx.sbg.StateBasedGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener

    public abstract class StateBasedGame
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener
    Author:
    Exobros State based Game version of teh libGDX ApplicationListener (similar but not equal to slick2Ds)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StateBasedGame()
      Creates a new StateBasedGame with the default update Interval (10ms)
      StateBasedGame(int updateInterval)
      Creates a new StateBasedGame with the specific updateInterval

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addState(java.lang.String id, GameState gs)
      Adds a state to this StateBasedGame's stateList
      void create()
      initializes AssetManager initializes LoadingState initializes stateList (abstract Method initStateList() ) calls onCreate() of all States set LoadingState to current State starts the Update Thread
      void dispose()
      calls System.exit(-1)
      void enterState(java.lang.String id)
      calls the current state's onLeave() Method calls the current state's onEnter() Method Enters the state with the specific id
      java.lang.String getCurrentState()
      Returns the current State
      java.lang.String getFirstStateID()
      get the ID of the First state added
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,GameState> getStateList()
      get the StateList
      abstract void initStateList()
      called to initialize the statelist add all the States here
      abstract void loadResources(com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager am)
      queue the Resources to be loaded
      void pause()
      Allows for implementation of pause() from libGdx's Application Listener but does not require it
      void render()
      Clears the Screen calls render method of current state calls System.exit(-1) on Exception
      void resize(int width, int height)
      Allows for implementation of resize method from libGdx's Application Listener , but does not require it
      void resume()
      Allows for implementation of resume() from libGdx's Application Listener but does not require it
